The neighborhood is diverse with a mixture of grand Victorian style homes and even a bowling alley. Within 6 minutes from the PJ Factory we went on bicycle rides at the river, and had locally roasted coffee. Around every corner in the PJ Factory are cute space that just make you smile. So many plants, nooks, and spaces to read, play pool or other games! The court yard space is UNBELIEVABLE! So many beautiful plants and flowers! Lots of seating, outdoor grill, cornhole, and life size jenga.
I felt super safe and everyone I encountered was so nice. There's a soul food truck vendor literally right out side the door. I doubt you will find anything as interesting as this in the area.

review_text: If you are looking for a unique, local experience for your stay in the Susquehanna Valley, look no further - Sara’s space at the Pajama Factory was exactly what I was looking for. I’ve been staying in the area a few times a year for over a decade, and the last three years I’d found an Airbnb where the hosts became like family & I didn’t look elsewhere. They sold their home last year & I’ve been dreading trying to find somewhere else that didn’t feel like an impersonal, hotel chain experience - that also took dogs, & wasn’t more expensive than a hotel. I hit the jackpot finding this place - it was probably the coolest Airbnb I’ve ever stayed, actually. It was like staying in an artists’ collective/dorm, and getting an inside glimpse into the art scene in Williamsport which I had no idea was so robust. The actual building itself was so cool - I could’ve spent another 3 days just exploring and taking photos. The courtyard has multiple seating areas, for rain or shine. The studio itself has big, beautiful windows that look out onto the courtyard - they were my favorite part of the space for sure. Cool bathroom with nice rain shower & detachable shower head, little stove & fridge, cool wood floors & art throughout the space - Sara makes stained glass pieces and I actually bought one she had in her window because it was so beautiful! My iPhone wouldn’t work with the plug for the TV so if TV is a must for you, might want to make sure you bring the right equipment to be able to plug in! review_text: Fantastic—in a word. There is something very special about these accommodations that deserves explaining, concerning the “inner” and “outer” experience. First, the inner: it’s a studio, but a larger one that the pictures seems to show. There is plenty of space for a 2 people (we are a couple, in our early 60s), tall ceilings and a large, light-filled window occupying the better part of one wall. As for the outer experience: this third-floor studio is one part of a great whole, the Pajama Factory building, which is the vision—wholly realized, and ongoing—of an artist/community/commercial “happening” that doesn’t just fulfil a community (and human) need for such a place, but has, one can tell, helped bring it into being. To walk the halls on several floors is to feel a part of “art in progress,” not to mention all the artwork on display to admire. My feeling is that Williamsport is a significantly better place for its existence. (As to the activity in the building: have no concern, there is quiet and politeness throughout—you really get the sense that the people who come and go are truly happy to be a part of this.) And then fully outside: Williamsport is a cool little town, good restaurants, a river walk, other notable buildings and neighborhoods…and then beyond, the PA Grand Canyon area and state/other parks with hiking to impressive heights for amazing views—all within 20 – 30 minutes: this is a part of PA and our country that really deserves exploration…but which you can be sure will never be overrun and overcommercialized. Really a great experience!

What a fantastic stay our family of 9 had at Creekside Manor! The property is easy to find with Mike's clear directions that even included a few pictures of landmarks on the way. It was perfectly cleaned before our arrival and the check-in process was simple. A detailed note on the kitchen table answered any and all questions about the house itself and Mike was so helpful before and during our stay, providing extra info on the surrounding area and the best places to eat and visit. Our family is from this area but didn't know anything about Forksville (and their delicious steak subs) or World's End State Park with the cool Rock Garden and stunning views of the valley.
The house was spacious with plenty of room for our 2 families to stay and many friends and relatives to stop by for visits. There are plenty of spaces to sit around and chat or relax, (especially the family room, kitchen and outdoor backyard seating areas) play games and eat. There is a closet with a stack of games for all ages!
I loved the attention to detail throughout this house. Nice fixtures, any appliance you can think of needing, a large refrigerator, pantry and even a folding table and drying rack in the basement laundry room. To me, one of the best details was the ample supply of hooks and towel racks in the bathrooms and bedrooms! We've stayed at many vacation homes through the years and nobody seems to think about a large group of people all taking showers in the morning and having so many wet towels and washcloths that need to hang dry. It seems like a small thing but we really appreciated your forethought on this and many other things Mike and Sherri!
The Creek itself and perfect fire pit were among our favorite places to hang out with family, friends and relatives. There is plenty of outdoor lighting around the house also if you need it for night time activities. S'mores, Hotdogs and Jiffy Pop Popcorn done on the fire (built with the ample supply of kindling and wood provided), catching (and releasing) crayfish in the creek and fireflies at night brought our minds back to our childhoods and gave our kids a great experience they never get to have in Florida or Houston. I'm sure they'll remember this time far into adulthood!
The check-out process was simple as well. There is a list posted on the fridge noting the few simple things that need to be done before leaving.
We certainly will stay at Creekside Manor whenever we visit up in PA - Great House, Great Host - it could not have been more perfect!
Sincerely,
Sheryl, Lisa, Jim Rice and families
